title: Clean Code: A Handbook of Agile Software Craftsmanship
author: Robert C. Martin
Description: First and most well known of the Clean series of Uncle Bob, a must-read on TDD

title: The Clean Coder
author: Robert C. Martin
Description: What is a good Dev, where does he fit in an organization? How should he organize his time at work? Here you'll find advice on stuff like the pomodoro technique, pair programming, and more

title: The Phoenix Project
author: Gene Kim, Kevin Behr, George Spafford
Description: A book about the origins of Agile and DevOps and how it took inspiration from Lean in manufacturing. Not technical at all, but too important in the history of DevOps to be skipped

title: The DevOps Handbook
author: Gene Kim, Jez Humble, Patrick Debois, John Willis
Description: The practical follow-up to the Phoenix Project - Still not technical enough to go into actual DevOps tools

title: Accelerate
author: Nicole Forsgren, Jez Humble, Gene Kim
Description: Another foundational book about DevOps from a company organization perspective - like the DevOps Handbook but this one is based more on data issued from research

title: Nand to Tetris
author: H. G. Wells
Description: Ever wondered how ones and zeroes are put together to make a computer? This is the book that will answer all your questions

title: Building an 8-bit breadboard computer
author: Ben Eater
Description: This series of videos was particularly helpful to me when I was learning about computer architecture, but his entire website/YouTube channel is worth a visit

title: An unbiased evaluation of environment management and packaging tools
author: Anna-Lena Popkes
Description: The ultimate overview of tooling around the Python ecosystem

title: Introduction to Machine Learning with Python
author: Andreas C. Muller, Sarah Guido
Description: A great, albeit a little outdated first dip into ML using scikit-learn

title: PyTorch for Deep Learning & Machine Learning â€“ Full Course
author: freeCodeCamp.org
Description: How I learned PyTorch and made my first machine learning model. If you already know a little about Tensors, skip to the 6 hour mark

title: Machine Learning with Pythorch and Scikit-Learn
author: S. Raschka,Y. H. Liu & V. Mirjalili

title: Learn Git Branching
author: Git
Description: A fun little game to learn about branching and merging
